Pre-Game Insights: The Padres are slight favorites at -120, while the Braves are +120 underdogs.
The Padres' offense has been led by Manny Machado, who hit 29 home runs with 105 RBIs, and Luis Arraez, who posted a.318 average.
Joe Musgrove will start for San Diego in Game 2, while Max Fried will start for Atlanta.
The Padres have a.263 team batting average, and their ability to hit for power and average puts pressure on opposing pitching staffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves are fighting to extend their season, but the Padres’ home-field advantage will give them a hard battle again.
The Padres have won four of their last five matchups against Atlanta this season.
The under is 5-2 in the Padres’ last seven home games.
Others: The Padres took Game 1 of this series in commanding fashion, winning 4-0 and shutting down the Braves' offense.
The Padres are 7-3 in their last 10 games as favorites.
